title: 105_s163
content: The National Academies of Practice is recognized and granted a Federal charter. The corporation's powers are limited to those granted in its bylaws and articles of incorporation. Its purposes include honoring individuals in various healthcare professions and improving practices through the dissemination of information. The corporation must comply with state laws for service of process, membership eligibility and rights are outlined in the bylaws, the board of directors composition and responsibilities are specified in the articles of incorporation, and officers are elected in accordance with state laws and the articles of incorporation. SEC. 8. RESTRICTIONS. The corporation is prohibited from distributing income or assets to members, officers, or directors. Reasonable compensation and reimbursement for expenses are allowed. Loans to officers, directors, or employees are not permitted. Political activity and attempts to influence legislation are also prohibited. The corporation cannot issue stock or pay dividends. The corporation is prohibited from distributing income or assets to members, officers, or directors. It cannot issue stock or pay dividends. It is also not allowed to claim congressional approval or Federal Government authority for any activities. The corporation is liable for the acts of its officers and agents within their authority. Maintenance and inspection of books and records are required. SEC. 10. The corporation must maintain correct and complete books and records of account, including minutes of proceedings involving members, the board of directors, or committees. It must also keep a record of members' names and addresses. Members have the right to inspect these records for proper purposes. SEC. 11. Financial transactions are subject to audit. SEC. 11. Audit of financial transactions. The Act is amended to include the National Academies of Practice as paragraph (75). SEC. 12. ANNUAL REPORT. The corporation must report annually to Congress on its activities during the previous fiscal year, to be submitted along with the audit report required by section 3. The report will not be made public. SEC. 13. RESERVATION OF RIGHT TO AMEND OR REPEAL CHARTER. Congress reserves the right to alter, amend, or repeal this Act. SEC. 14. DEFINITION. The term "State" in this Act includes the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and other U.S. territories. SEC. 15. TAX-EXEMPT STATUS. The corporation must maintain its tax-exempt status as per the Internal Revenue Code. SEC. 16. TERMINATION. If the corporation fails to comply with the restrictions or provisions of this Act, the charter granted by this Act shall terminate.
